Rensselaer Motorsport - Control Systems.description: Developing a new ECU for Rensselaer Motorsport's RM27. The ECU will be based on the Jetson Nano microcontroller and will be used to control the vehicle's powertrain and other systems. I am currently leading a design team for the hardware and software implementation of the ECU with a team at Rensselaer's Center for Open Source. I am actively working on the Control Systems models in MATLAB, on the side.

modal.detailed_description: Leading the development of an advanced Electronic Control Unit (ECU) for Rensselaer Motorsport's RM27 Formula SAE vehicle. This project represents a significant leap in vehicle control systems, integrating multiple subsystems including powertrain management, data acquisition, and safety monitoring. Working with a multidisciplinary team to develop both hardware and software components that meet strict competition regulations while pushing performance boundaries.

context.title: Formula SAE Engineering Excellence
context.content: Formula SAE is the world's most prestigious engineering design competition where university teams design, build, and race small formula-style cars. This ECU project pushes the boundaries of automotive control systems in a highly competitive environment where performance, reliability, and innovation are paramount.

technical_details.title: Real-Time Control Systems
technical_details.content: Implementing advanced control algorithms using Jetson Nano for real-time vehicle dynamics management, including traction control, launch control, and comprehensive data logging systems with sub-millisecond response times.

technical_details.title: Hardware Integration
technical_details.content: Custom PCB design and sensor integration for CAN bus communication, with emphasis on reliability and electromagnetic compatibility in harsh racing environments. Designing fail-safe mechanisms and redundant systems.

technical_details.title: MATLAB Control Modeling
technical_details.content: Developing sophisticated control models in MATLAB for vehicle dynamics simulation, powertrain optimization, and performance prediction to validate real-world implementation strategies.

impact.title: Performance Innovation
impact.content: Expected 15% improvement in lap times through optimized powertrain control, advanced traction management, and data-driven setup adjustments based on real-time telemetry.

impact.title: Team Leadership Excellence
impact.content: Leading a diverse team of 8+ engineers across electrical, software, and mechanical disciplines to deliver integrated vehicle systems under tight competition deadlines.

impact.title: Competition Advantage
impact.content: Developing cutting-edge technology that positions Rensselaer Motorsport as a leader in Formula SAE innovation and performance engineering.

challenges.title: Real-Time Performance Constraints
challenges.description: Ensuring control loop execution within 1ms timing constraints while managing multiple sensor inputs, actuator outputs, and complex vehicle dynamics calculations.

challenges.title: Safety-Critical System Design
challenges.description: Implementing comprehensive fail-safe mechanisms and redundant systems to meet stringent safety requirements for high-performance racing applications.

challenges.title: Cross-Disciplinary Integration
challenges.description: Coordinating hardware, software, and mechanical system requirements across multiple engineering disciplines while maintaining project timeline and budget constraints.

skills_gained: CAN bus protocols and automotive networking
Advanced control systems design and implementation
Technical team leadership and project management

RPI Robotic Art Installation.description: Art installation for the RPI campus. Will be comprised of several dozen origami units that open and close in response to user stimulus from a computer vision system. Serving as the Team Lead for the project, helping out with programming and electrical work.

modal.detailed_description: An innovative interactive art installation combining robotics, computer vision, and artistic expression for the RPI campus. The installation features several dozen responsive origami units that create dynamic visual patterns through coordinated movement based on real-time computer vision analysis of user interactions. This project bridges the gap between technology and art, creating an engaging public space that responds to human presence and movement.

context.title: Interactive Art & Technology Integration
context.content: This installation represents the intersection of engineering and artistic expression, demonstrating how advanced robotics and computer vision can create meaningful human-technology interactions in public spaces. The project showcases RPI's commitment to innovation in both technical and creative domains.

technical_details.title: Computer Vision System
technical_details.content: Real-time person detection and tracking using advanced computer vision algorithms to analyze user movement patterns, proximity, and gestures for responsive art installation control.

technical_details.title: Coordinated Robotics
technical_details.content: Synchronized control of multiple origami units using distributed microcontroller systems with precise servo control and wireless communication for coordinated artistic movements.

technical_details.title: Interactive Design
technical_details.content: Algorithmic pattern generation that translates human movement into beautiful, flowing origami animations, creating unique artistic experiences for each interaction.

impact.title: Campus Enhancement
impact.content: Creating an engaging interactive experience that enhances the RPI campus environment and demonstrates the university's leadership in innovative technology applications.

impact.title: Interdisciplinary Collaboration
impact.content: Leading cross-functional teams combining engineering, computer science, and artistic design principles to create a unified technical-artistic vision.

impact.title: Research Innovation
impact.content: Advancing the field of interactive installations by developing novel approaches to human-robot interaction in artistic contexts.

challenges.title: Real-Time Responsiveness
challenges.description: Ensuring seamless, low-latency response to user interactions while coordinating dozens of mechanical units in real-time.

challenges.title: Outdoor Durability
challenges.description: Designing robust systems that can withstand weather conditions while maintaining precise mechanical operation and reliable electronics.

challenges.title: Artistic-Technical Balance
challenges.description: Balancing technical capabilities with artistic vision to create meaningful aesthetic experiences while maintaining system reliability.

Rensselaer Motorsport - RM26.description: Powertrain Lead for Rensselaer Motorsport's first electric vehicle. I worked on decision matrices and design reviews in favor of implementing an EMRAX 228 motor with Cascadia Rinehart PM100DX motor controller for our powertrain. I am currently working on the implementation, control systems, and high voltage routing for this configuration. I am also working on the battery management system for our accumulator battery.

modal.detailed_description: Served as Powertrain Lead for Rensselaer Motorsport's groundbreaking transition to electric vehicles with RM26. This historic project marked the team's first foray into electric powertrain technology, requiring comprehensive research, design, and implementation of high-voltage systems. Led the technical decision-making process for motor and controller selection, designed the battery management architecture, and oversaw the integration of all powertrain components while ensuring compliance with Formula SAE electric vehicle regulations.

context.title: Electric Vehicle Innovation in Formula SAE
context.content: RM26 represents a pivotal moment in Rensselaer Motorsport's history - the transition from internal combustion to electric powertrains. This shift required mastering entirely new technologies including high-voltage safety, battery management, electric motor control, and thermal management while maintaining competitive performance standards in Formula SAE competition.

technical_details.title: High-Performance Electric Powertrain
technical_details.content: Selected and integrated EMRAX 228 motor with Cascadia Rinehart PM100DX controller, delivering optimal power-to-weight ratio and efficiency for Formula SAE applications with regenerative braking capabilities.

technical_details.title: Advanced Battery Management System
technical_details.content: Designed comprehensive BMS architecture for lithium-ion accumulator with cell monitoring, balancing, thermal management, and safety shutdown systems compliant with Formula SAE EV regulations.

technical_details.title: High-Voltage System Integration
technical_details.content: Engineered complete HV routing, safety systems, and component integration including inverter mounting, cooling systems, and emergency shutdown procedures meeting strict safety standards.

impact.title: Technology Transition Leadership
impact.content: Successfully led Rensselaer Motorsport's transition to electric vehicles, establishing the foundation for future EV development and competitive performance in Formula SAE Electric.

impact.title: Performance Optimization
impact.content: Achieved competitive power delivery and efficiency through systematic component selection and integration, positioning the team for strong competition results.

impact.title: Safety Standard Excellence
impact.content: Implemented comprehensive safety systems and procedures that became the template for future electric vehicle projects, ensuring both performance and safety compliance.

challenges.title: Technology Learning Curve
challenges.description: Mastering electric vehicle technologies, high-voltage safety protocols, and battery management systems while transitioning from traditional ICE powertrains.

challenges.title: Regulatory Compliance
challenges.description: Ensuring all systems met stringent Formula SAE EV safety and technical regulations while maintaining competitive performance characteristics.

challenges.title: Integration Complexity
challenges.description: Coordinating electrical, mechanical, and software systems integration across multiple engineering disciplines under tight timeline constraints.

RPI Ungergrad Research: Inverse Kinemati.description: Worked on C++ implementation of subproblem solutions using a linear algebra approach from "Canonical Subproblems for Robot Inverse Kinematics"

modal.detailed_description: Contributed to cutting-edge robotics research through the development of advanced inverse kinematics algorithms using linear algebra approaches. This undergraduate research program focused on implementing canonical subproblem solutions that form the mathematical foundation for robot motion planning and control. Working with graduate students and faculty to advance the state of the art in robotic kinematics, contributing to open-source research that benefits the broader robotics community.

context.title: Advanced Robotics Research at RPI
context.content: This research contributes to RPI's renowned robotics program, working alongside faculty and graduate students to solve fundamental problems in robot motion planning. The work focuses on canonical subproblems that form the building blocks for more complex robotic systems and has applications in industrial automation, autonomous vehicles, and advanced manufacturing.

technical_details.title: Mathematical Algorithm Implementation
technical_details.content: Developed robust C++ implementations of canonical subproblem solutions using advanced linear algebra techniques, focusing on numerical stability and computational efficiency for real-time applications.

technical_details.title: Inverse Kinematics Solutions
technical_details.content: Implemented multiple solution strategies for inverse kinematics problems, handling both analytical and numerical approaches with emphasis on singularity avoidance and solution optimization.

technical_details.title: Linear Algebra Optimization
technical_details.content: Utilized advanced matrix operations and linear algebra libraries to optimize computational performance while maintaining numerical precision in kinematic calculations.

impact.title: Open Source Contribution
impact.content: Contributed to open-source research repository that serves as a foundation for other researchers and developers working on robotic kinematics problems.

impact.title: Academic Collaboration
impact.content: Worked directly with faculty and graduate students, contributing to ongoing research projects and gaining exposure to academic research methodologies.

impact.title: Foundation for Advanced Applications
impact.content: Research contributes to enabling more sophisticated robot control systems for industrial and autonomous applications.

challenges.title: Mathematical Complexity
challenges.description: Understanding and implementing complex mathematical concepts in inverse kinematics while ensuring numerical stability and computational efficiency.

challenges.title: Algorithm Optimization
challenges.description: Balancing mathematical rigor with practical computational constraints for real-time robotic applications.

challenges.title: Research Methodology
challenges.description: Learning academic research processes, documentation standards, and collaborative development practices in a research environment.

Rensselaer Motorsport - RM25.description: Worked on software and electric systems for Rensselaer Motorsport's 25th Formula SAE car, RM25.

modal.detailed_description: Contributed to the development of Rensselaer Motorsport's milestone 25th Formula SAE vehicle, RM25. This project marked a significant achievement in the team's history, combining traditional Formula SAE engineering excellence with modern software and electrical systems integration. Worked on multiple subsystems including embedded software development, electrical system design, and vehicle integration testing to ensure optimal performance and reliability for competition.

context.title: Formula SAE Heritage & Innovation
context.content: RM25 represents 25 years of Formula SAE excellence at Rensselaer, combining the team's rich engineering heritage with cutting-edge technology. This vehicle served as a stepping stone toward the team's electric vehicle transition while maintaining competitive performance in traditional Formula SAE competition.

technical_details.title: Embedded Software Development
technical_details.content: Developed and implemented embedded software systems for vehicle control, data acquisition, and driver interface systems using modern programming practices and real-time constraints.

technical_details.title: Electrical System Integration
technical_details.content: Designed and implemented electrical systems including wiring harnesses, sensor integration, and control module connectivity ensuring reliable operation under racing conditions.

technical_details.title: Vehicle System Testing
technical_details.content: Conducted comprehensive system testing and integration validation to ensure all software and electrical components functioned correctly under various operating conditions.

impact.title: Competition Success
impact.content: Contributed to successful vehicle deployment and competition performance, maintaining Rensselaer Motorsport's reputation for engineering excellence.

impact.title: Technology Foundation
impact.content: Established software and electrical system foundations that would support the team's transition to electric vehicle technology in subsequent projects.

impact.title: Team Integration
impact.content: Successfully integrated software and electrical systems with mechanical components through effective cross-disciplinary collaboration.

challenges.title: System Integration Complexity
challenges.description: Coordinating software and electrical systems with mechanical components while meeting strict competition deadlines and performance requirements.

challenges.title: Reliability Under Stress
challenges.description: Ensuring all electronic systems maintained reliability and performance under the demanding conditions of competitive racing.

challenges.title: Legacy System Integration
challenges.description: Integrating new software and electrical technologies with established team practices and existing system architectures.

Power Take-Off Gearbox.description: Drop-in replacement for VexPro Three CIM Ball Shifter, while providing independent outputs to two mechanisms. All electronics and pneumatics are located to one side (to prevent interference with wheels and chassis), and the second output is fitted with a power shuttle to reverse output direction (in the case that both outputs run at the same time).

modal.detailed_description: Designed and developed an innovative mechanical solution for FRC robotics applications, creating a sophisticated power transmission system that significantly improves upon existing VexPro solutions. This custom gearbox addresses critical design challenges in robotics by providing dual independent outputs while maintaining compact packaging and optimal component placement. The design demonstrates advanced mechanical engineering principles including gear train optimization, pneumatic integration, and space-efficient layout for competitive robotics applications.

context.title: Advanced Robotics Drivetrain Innovation
context.content: This project addresses fundamental limitations in existing FRC drivetrain components by providing enhanced functionality through innovative mechanical design. The Power Take-Off Gearbox represents a significant advancement in robotics power transmission, enabling more sophisticated robot mechanisms while maintaining the reliability and performance required for competitive robotics.

technical_details.title: Dual Independent Output System
technical_details.content: Engineered sophisticated gear train providing two independent mechanical outputs from a single input source, enabling simultaneous control of multiple robot mechanisms with precision and efficiency.

technical_details.title: Integrated Pneumatic Power Shuttle
technical_details.content: Designed and implemented pneumatic power shuttle system for dynamic output direction reversal, allowing flexible mechanism control during competition scenarios.

technical_details.title: Space-Optimized Component Layout
technical_details.content: Achieved compact, single-sided electronics and pneumatics placement to prevent chassis interference while maintaining accessibility for maintenance and adjustment.

impact.title: Performance Enhancement
impact.content: Provided significant improvement over standard VexPro solutions, enabling more sophisticated robot designs and enhanced competitive performance capabilities.

impact.title: Design Innovation
impact.content: Created novel mechanical solution that addresses multiple engineering challenges simultaneously, demonstrating advanced problem-solving in mechanical design.

impact.title: Manufacturing Excellence
impact.content: Developed manufacturable design that balances performance requirements with practical fabrication constraints and cost considerations.

challenges.title: Multi-Output Coordination
challenges.description: Engineering precise coordination between dual outputs while maintaining independent control authority and preventing mechanical interference.

challenges.title: Space Constraint Optimization
challenges.description: Achieving compact design that accommodates all necessary components while preventing interference with other robot systems and maintaining serviceability.

challenges.title: Performance vs. Complexity Balance
challenges.description: Optimizing mechanical complexity to provide advanced functionality while maintaining reliability and ease of manufacturing within competition constraints.

Aquila Heavy.description: Thrust Vector Controlled model rocket using a dual Arduino telemetry and control system. Can recorded flight data like altitude, pitch, yaw, and roll along with camera feed.

modal.detailed_description: Developed a sophisticated thrust vector controlled model rocket system featuring advanced flight control, telemetry, and data acquisition capabilities. Aquila Heavy represents a comprehensive aerospace engineering project combining mechanical design, control systems, embedded programming, and real-time data processing. The dual Arduino architecture enables complex flight control algorithms while maintaining robust telemetry and video recording capabilities, demonstrating practical applications of aerospace control theory in a model rocketry platform.

context.title: Advanced Model Rocketry & Control Systems
context.content: This project explores cutting-edge model rocketry technology by implementing thrust vector control (TVC) systems typically found in professional launch vehicles. Aquila Heavy serves as a practical testbed for aerospace engineering concepts including flight dynamics, control theory, and real-time embedded systems in a challenging flight environment.

technical_details.title: Thrust Vector Control System
technical_details.content: Implemented sophisticated TVC using servo-actuated engine gimbal system with real-time feedback control, enabling active flight path correction and stability enhancement during powered flight phases.

technical_details.title: Dual Arduino Telemetry Architecture
technical_details.content: Designed redundant control system using dual Arduino processors for flight control and data acquisition, ensuring system reliability and enabling complex multi-threaded operations during flight.

technical_details.title: Comprehensive Flight Data Recording
technical_details.content: Developed multi-sensor data acquisition system capturing altitude, 6-DOF orientation data, acceleration, and synchronized video feed for complete flight analysis and performance evaluation.

impact.title: Advanced Control System Validation
impact.content: Successfully demonstrated practical implementation of aerospace control theory in model rocket platform, validating TVC algorithms and flight control methodologies.

impact.title: Performance Data Analysis
impact.content: Generated comprehensive flight performance datasets enabling detailed analysis of rocket dynamics, control system effectiveness, and aerodynamic behavior.

impact.title: Educational Research Platform
impact.content: Created reusable platform for ongoing aerospace engineering research and experimentation, enabling future projects and design iterations.

challenges.title: Real-Time Flight Control
challenges.description: Implementing stable, responsive thrust vector control algorithms operating within the demanding constraints of model rocket flight dynamics and limited computational resources.

challenges.title: System Integration Complexity
challenges.description: Coordinating multiple subsystems including mechanical actuators, sensors, data logging, and video recording within strict weight and space constraints of model rocket platform.

challenges.title: Reliability in Harsh Conditions
challenges.description: Ensuring electronic systems remain operational under high acceleration, vibration, and thermal stress conditions experienced during rocket flight.

skills_gained: Aerospace control system design and implementation

ML-CV.description: Hybrid Computer Vision System coded in Python for the 2020/21 FRC game. Utilizes OpenCV algorithms alongside a Transfer Trained MobileNet SSD model for video processing and error correction. Uses Tornado and Websockets for relaying data to the robot and driver.

modal.detailed_description: Developed an innovative hybrid computer vision system that combines traditional OpenCV algorithms with modern deep learning techniques for enhanced FRC robot vision capabilities. This sophisticated system leverages transfer learning on MobileNet SSD architecture to achieve superior object detection accuracy while maintaining real-time performance requirements. The integration of classical computer vision with machine learning represents a cutting-edge approach to competitive robotics vision systems, featuring robust network communication and error correction mechanisms.

context.title: Next-Generation FRC Vision Technology
context.content: This project represents the evolution of FRC vision systems from traditional OpenCV-based approaches to hybrid AI-enhanced solutions. Developed for the 2020/21 FRC season, ML-CV addresses the increasing complexity of game elements and environmental challenges through the strategic combination of classical computer vision and modern deep learning techniques.

technical_details.title: Hybrid AI-Classical Vision Pipeline
technical_details.content: Integrated transfer-trained MobileNet SSD deep learning model with traditional OpenCV algorithms, creating a robust system that leverages the strengths of both approaches for optimal detection accuracy and performance.

technical_details.title: Intelligent Error Correction System
technical_details.content: Implemented sophisticated error correction algorithms that cross-validate results between classical and ML approaches, significantly improving system reliability and reducing false positives in competition environments.

technical_details.title: Real-time Network Communication
technical_details.content: Developed high-performance networking solution using Tornado web framework and WebSocket protocols for ultra-low latency data transmission to robot control systems and driver interfaces.

impact.title: Competitive Advantage Achievement
impact.content: Provided significant competitive advantage through superior detection accuracy and reliability compared to traditional vision systems, enabling more sophisticated autonomous operation.

impact.title: Innovation in FRC Vision
impact.content: Pioneered the integration of deep learning techniques in FRC competition environment, establishing new standards for vision system capabilities and performance.

impact.title: Knowledge Base Contribution
impact.content: Created comprehensive documentation and open-source implementation that enables other FRC teams to adopt similar hybrid vision approaches.

challenges.title: Performance Optimization Balance
challenges.description: Achieving optimal balance between deep learning model accuracy and real-time performance requirements within computational constraints of FRC robot platforms.

challenges.title: Model Training and Optimization
challenges.description: Successfully implementing transfer learning techniques to adapt MobileNet SSD for specific FRC game elements while maintaining generalization capabilities.

challenges.title: System Integration Complexity
challenges.description: Seamlessly integrating classical computer vision, deep learning models, and network communication systems into a cohesive, reliable competition-ready platform.

skills_gained: Deep learning model integration and optimization

BlueComms.description: Cross-Computer communication for functions like copy, paste, cut, etc. using Bluetooth. Currently working on designing an installer for the code so that it can run as a background program instead of a script that must be manually executed on machine startup.

modal.detailed_description: Developed an innovative cross-platform communication solution that enables seamless clipboard operations between multiple computers using Bluetooth connectivity. BlueComms addresses the growing need for efficient multi-device workflows by providing transparent, wireless clipboard sharing that feels native to each operating system. The project demonstrates advanced understanding of system-level programming, wireless protocols, and user experience design through the creation of a sophisticated background service architecture.

context.title: Multi-Device Workflow Enhancement
context.content: In today's multi-device computing environment, BlueComms addresses the fundamental challenge of seamless data transfer between computers. This project recognizes the inefficiencies in current workflow patterns and provides an elegant solution through wireless clipboard synchronization, significantly enhancing productivity for users working across multiple machines.

technical_details.title: Bluetooth Protocol Implementation
technical_details.content: Developed robust Bluetooth communication protocol for reliable, low-latency clipboard data transmission between paired devices, handling various data types and ensuring secure connections.

technical_details.title: System-Level Integration
technical_details.content: Implemented deep system integration for seamless clipboard monitoring and manipulation across multiple operating systems, ensuring native-feeling user experience without manual intervention.

technical_details.title: Background Service Architecture
technical_details.content: Designed comprehensive background service system with automatic startup capabilities, system tray integration, and persistent connection management for transparent operation.

impact.title: Productivity Enhancement
impact.content: Significantly improved workflow efficiency for multi-device users by eliminating friction in cross-device data transfer and enabling seamless computing experiences.

impact.title: User Experience Innovation
impact.content: Created intuitive, transparent solution that requires no user training or workflow changes, demonstrating excellent user-centered design principles.

impact.title: Cross-Platform Compatibility
impact.content: Developed solution that works across different operating systems, providing universal utility and broad applicability for diverse computing environments.

challenges.title: Cross-Platform System Integration
challenges.description: Developing consistent functionality across different operating systems while handling platform-specific clipboard APIs and Bluetooth stack variations.

challenges.title: Reliable Wireless Communication
challenges.description: Ensuring robust Bluetooth connectivity with automatic reconnection capabilities and graceful handling of connection interruptions and device pairing issues.

challenges.title: Background Service Development
challenges.description: Creating seamless background operation with proper installer design, automatic startup functionality, and minimal system resource utilization.

HawkEye.description: Computer Vision System coded in Python for the 2020 FRC game. Utilizes OpenCV, Tornado, and Websockets for video processing and relaying data to the robot and driver.

modal.detailed_description: Developed a comprehensive computer vision system for the 2020 FIRST Robotics Competition, providing advanced visual processing capabilities for autonomous robot operation and driver assistance. HawkEye represents a complete vision pipeline solution optimized for the dynamic, fast-paced environment of FRC competition. The system integrates sophisticated image processing algorithms with high-performance networking to deliver real-time visual data to robot control systems and human drivers, significantly enhancing competitive performance.

context.title: FRC 2020 'Infinite Recharge' Vision Solution
context.content: Developed for the 2020 FRC season game 'Infinite Recharge', HawkEye provided critical vision capabilities for power cell detection, target identification, and autonomous navigation. This system enabled Team 2601 SteelHawks to compete at the highest levels through advanced computer vision technology.

technical_details.title: Advanced OpenCV Processing Pipeline
technical_details.content: Implemented sophisticated computer vision algorithms using OpenCV for real-time object detection, tracking, and measurement, optimized for FRC game elements and competition lighting conditions.

technical_details.title: High-Performance Network Communication
technical_details.content: Developed ultra-low latency networking solution using Tornado web framework and WebSocket protocols to stream processed vision data to robot systems and driver stations in real-time.

technical_details.title: Competition-Optimized Processing
technical_details.content: Fine-tuned algorithms for the specific requirements of FRC competition environment, including variable lighting, fast-moving targets, and strict real-time performance constraints.

impact.title: Competitive Performance Enhancement
impact.content: Enabled superior autonomous period performance and enhanced driver capabilities, contributing directly to improved match scores and competition rankings for Team 2601.

impact.title: Team Technical Foundation
impact.content: Established comprehensive vision system architecture that became the foundation for future FRC seasons and advanced vision projects like ML-CV.

impact.title: Open Source Contribution
impact.content: Provided complete implementation as open-source project, enabling other FRC teams to benefit from advanced vision capabilities and contributing to the broader FRC community.

challenges.title: Real-Time Performance Under Pressure
challenges.description: Achieving consistent, reliable vision processing performance in the high-stress, variable conditions of FRC competition environments while maintaining low latency requirements.

challenges.title: Dynamic Environmental Adaptation
challenges.description: Developing robust algorithms that maintain accuracy across varying lighting conditions, camera angles, and field configurations encountered in different competition venues.

challenges.title: Network Reliability and Integration
challenges.description: Ensuring stable, high-performance network communication between vision processing systems and robot control platforms under competition network constraints.

FRC 2601 - 2K20 Robot, Hylo Wren.description: Worked on various software systems with other engineers on the team for FRC Team 2601's 2020 robot.

modal.detailed_description: Contributed to the development of Hylo Wren, Team 2601 SteelHawks' 2020 competition robot designed for the 'Infinite Recharge' FRC game. This project involved collaborative software engineering efforts to create sophisticated control systems that enabled the robot to excel in power cell manipulation, climbing mechanisms, and autonomous operation. The work demonstrates advanced understanding of competitive robotics software architecture and the ability to contribute effectively to complex, time-critical engineering projects under competition pressure.

context.title: FRC 2020 'Infinite Recharge' Competition Robot
context.content: The 2020 FRC season featured the 'Infinite Recharge' game where robots needed to score power cells in various targets and navigate complex field obstacles. Hylo Wren was designed to excel in this challenging environment through sophisticated software systems that coordinated multiple mechanisms and enabled both autonomous and teleoperated performance.

technical_details.title: Multi-System Robot Control Architecture
technical_details.content: Developed integrated software systems coordinating drivetrain, manipulation mechanisms, climbing systems, and autonomous routines within a unified control architecture optimized for competition performance.

technical_details.title: Game-Specific Automation Systems
technical_details.content: Implemented specialized control algorithms for power cell handling, target acquisition, and scoring mechanisms tailored specifically to the requirements of the 'Infinite Recharge' game.

technical_details.title: Collaborative Software Development
technical_details.content: Participated in team-based software development using version control, code review processes, and collaborative debugging to ensure reliable, maintainable competition code.

impact.title: Competition Performance Success
impact.content: Contributed to successful robot performance in the 2020 FRC season, with software systems enabling competitive autonomous scoring and reliable teleoperated control.

impact.title: Team Collaboration Excellence
impact.content: Demonstrated effective collaboration in high-pressure engineering environment, contributing to team success through reliable software engineering and problem-solving.

impact.title: Technical Foundation Building
impact.content: Established software architecture and development practices that supported future team projects and provided foundation for advanced vision systems like HawkEye.

challenges.title: Competition Timeline Pressure
challenges.description: Developing reliable, high-performance software systems within the compressed timeline of FRC build season while meeting strict competition deadlines.

challenges.title: Multi-System Integration
challenges.description: Coordinating software for multiple robot subsystems while ensuring reliable operation and maintainable code architecture under competition conditions.

challenges.title: Team Coordination and Communication
challenges.description: Effectively collaborating with multiple engineers on shared codebase while maintaining code quality and system reliability standards.

skills_gained: Collaborative software development in engineering teams
Version control and team development workflows

Swerve Drive.description: Worked on the development of a swerve drivetrain prototype for my FRC team. I designed CAD models for the modules and chassis of a swerve drive. In addition, I developed the control systems for both robot orientated and field orientated control of the swerve.

modal.detailed_description: Designed and developed a sophisticated swerve drive system representing one of the most advanced drivetrain technologies in competitive robotics. This comprehensive project encompassed both mechanical design and control systems development, creating a prototype that demonstrates mastery of complex mechanical engineering principles. The swerve drive enables omnidirectional movement with independent wheel speed and direction control, providing superior maneuverability compared to traditional drivetrain systems and representing cutting-edge technology in FRC robotics.

context.title: Advanced Robotics Drivetrain Technology
context.content: Swerve drive systems represent the pinnacle of FRC drivetrain technology, requiring sophisticated mechanical design and control algorithms. This project addresses the challenge of creating highly maneuverable robots capable of omnidirectional movement, rotation while translating, and precise field positioning - capabilities that provide significant competitive advantages in FRC competition scenarios.

technical_details.title: Advanced CAD Design and Modeling
technical_details.content: Developed comprehensive CAD models for swerve modules and chassis integration, including precise mechanical tolerances, assembly constraints, and manufacturing considerations for high-performance drivetrain components.

technical_details.title: Dual-Axis Control Systems
technical_details.content: Implemented sophisticated control algorithms managing both drive motor speed and steering angle for each module, enabling independent control of translation and rotation for omnidirectional movement capabilities.

technical_details.title: Robot and Field-Oriented Control
technical_details.content: Developed comprehensive control modes including robot-centric control for intuitive driving and field-oriented control for strategic positioning, with seamless switching between control paradigms during operation.

impact.title: Drivetrain Technology Advancement
impact.content: Created prototype that significantly advanced team's drivetrain capabilities, enabling more sophisticated robot designs and enhanced competitive performance through superior maneuverability.

impact.title: Engineering Excellence Demonstration
impact.content: Showcased advanced mechanical engineering and control systems integration, establishing technical leadership and demonstrating mastery of complex robotic systems design.

impact.title: Strategic Competitive Advantage
impact.content: Provided foundation for superior field positioning and maneuverability that translates directly to competitive advantages in match scenarios and autonomous operation.

challenges.title: Mechanical Complexity Management
challenges.description: Designing reliable mechanical systems that coordinate multiple independent modules while maintaining precision, durability, and maintainability under competition conditions.

challenges.title: Control Algorithm Development
challenges.description: Implementing sophisticated mathematical models and control algorithms that coordinate four independent swerve modules for smooth, predictable omnidirectional movement.

challenges.title: Integration and Optimization
challenges.description: Balancing mechanical design constraints with control system requirements while optimizing for performance, manufacturability, and competitive reliability.

skills_gained: Advanced CAD modeling and mechanical design
Swerve drive kinematics and control theory

FRC 2601 - 2K19 Robot, Cygnus.description: Worked on various software systems with other engineers on the team for FRC Team 2601's 2019 robot.

modal.detailed_description: Contributed to the software development for Cygnus, Team 2601 SteelHawks' 2019 competition robot designed for the 'Deep Space' FRC game. This project involved developing control systems for hatch panel and cargo manipulation, as well as climbing mechanisms for the habitat platform. The experience provided foundational knowledge in competitive robotics programming and established patterns for collaborative software development that would support future, more advanced projects.

context.title: FRC 2019 'Deep Space' Competition Robot
context.content: The 2019 FRC season featured the 'Deep Space' game with space-themed challenges including cargo and hatch panel scoring at multiple levels, plus climbing onto habitat platforms. Cygnus was engineered to excel in this complex game through reliable control systems and strategic mechanism design.

technical_details.title: Game Mechanism Control Systems
technical_details.content: Developed control algorithms for cargo intake, hatch panel manipulation, and multi-level scoring systems, ensuring reliable operation during both autonomous and teleoperated periods.

technical_details.title: Climbing System Integration
technical_details.content: Implemented software for habitat climbing mechanisms, coordinating multiple actuators and safety systems to achieve reliable end-game performance.

technical_details.title: Team Development Practices
technical_details.content: Participated in collaborative programming using team development workflows, version control, and systematic testing procedures to ensure code reliability.

impact.title: Competitive Performance Contribution
impact.content: Supported successful competition performance through reliable software systems that enabled consistent scoring and strategic gameplay execution.

impact.title: Foundational Learning Experience
impact.content: Established fundamental understanding of competitive robotics software architecture that provided the foundation for future leadership roles and advanced projects.

impact.title: Collaborative Engineering Excellence
impact.content: Developed effective teamwork and communication skills essential for complex engineering projects and competitive robotics success.

challenges.title: Learning Complex Game Requirements
challenges.description: Understanding and implementing software solutions for the multifaceted challenges of the 'Deep Space' game while learning competitive robotics development practices.

challenges.title: Reliable System Integration

FRC 2601 - 2K18 Robot, Steel Hawking.description: Worked on various software systems with other engineers on the team for FRC Team 2601's 2018 robot.

modal.detailed_description: Contributed to the software development for Steel Hawking, Team 2601 SteelHawks' 2018 competition robot designed for the 'Power Up' FRC game. This initial foray into competitive robotics programming involved working with experienced team members to develop control systems for cube manipulation, scale balancing, and autonomous routines. The project provided essential introduction to robotics software engineering and established the foundation for future technical leadership and advanced project development.

context.title: FRC 2018 'Power Up' - First Competition Experience
context.content: The 2018 FRC season featured the 'Power Up' game with arcade-themed challenges including cube placement on scales and switches, plus climbing for power-ups. Steel Hawking represented the beginning of a competitive robotics journey, providing crucial learning experiences in team-based engineering and competition-focused development.

technical_details.title: Basic Control System Implementation
technical_details.content: Developed fundamental robot control software for cube manipulation, drivetrain operation, and basic autonomous functions while learning competitive robotics programming practices.

technical_details.title: Learning-Focused Development
technical_details.content: Focused on understanding robotics software architecture, sensor integration, and control system fundamentals while contributing to team success under mentorship of experienced programmers.

technical_details.title: Foundation Building Experience
technical_details.content: Established essential skills in team collaboration, version control, testing procedures, and competition-focused software development that enabled future technical leadership.

impact.title: Technical Journey Beginning
impact.content: Launched competitive robotics career and technical development journey that led to leadership roles in subsequent seasons and advanced project development.

impact.title: Competition Contribution
impact.content: Supported team's competitive performance through reliable software contributions and collaborative development practices during rookie programming experience.

impact.title: Skills Foundation Establishment
impact.content: Developed fundamental robotics programming skills and team collaboration practices that enabled future technical innovations and leadership opportunities.

challenges.title: Steep Learning Curve
challenges.description: Rapidly acquiring competitive robotics programming skills while contributing meaningfully to team success within the compressed timeline of FRC build season.

challenges.title: Complex System Understanding
